news uk-news muslim-man-says-vomiting-days-"Burger King customer vomits after bacon is added into burgerByBen ThompsonAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A Muslim customer was left vomiting for days after claiming his Burger King double cheeseburger was loaded with bacon.Gundogdu Yuzudik, , claims he had repeatedly asked for staff to not include bacon in his meal. He says he was unable to eat for days after the apparent mix-up on January . He said after taking one bite into his double cheeseburger he found it was stuffed with bacon. The fast-food fan shared his ordeal on TikTok and says he has avoided bacon his entire le for religious reasons. However, other social media users have claimed that Burger Kingaposs cheeseburgers are not halal anyway. In a video, which has been viewed more than , times, Gundogdu told the burger chain to sort their staff out as he felt that his simple instructions were not followed.Gundogdu also reveals that he was left vomiting and suffering headaches and claims it has impacted his mental and physical health.The Stansted airport employee said he was shocked he was offered two free Whopper meals as an apology, after vowing to neverto Burger King again. Burger King has since apologised for the error and said they are retraining their team to aposminimiseapos mistakes like this. Gundogdu, from Enfield, Greater London, said: I was on my lunch break and I headed to Burger King to get a double cheeseburger. I specically say with all my meals aposno baconapos, and itaposs always been correct. I told this to the till lady a couple of times, and when I got my food, I didnapost expect otherwise.  It was a simple instruction. Itaposs a mistake and weaposre all human, but it wasnapost busy so they werenapost working under pressure so there wasnapost a reason for them to have made a mistake. Itaposs just down to basic instructions. Weaposre all human, we all make mistakes, I appreciate that. When I went to eat my burger, I took a bite and it didnapost taste right. I opened the bun and it was loaded with bacon. Even the smallest bite made me feel mentally and physically sick. For three days after, I wasnapost eating properly. I was physically hungry but I couldnapost eat without vomiting. I was feeling sick. The thought of the bacon made me feel sick. Even when Iaposd be chewing anything, I was automatically thinking it was bacon. The first day, I didnapost eat. By the third day, I was slowly getting back to eating. I was starving, but I physically and mentally couldnapost eat anything.  Itaposd been my plan that I was never going to eat it in my le. I didnapost know whether I was going to have an allergic reaction. Thataposs how important it was to me. I went back to the Burger King and complained, but they werenapost very helpful. They just apologised and that was it. Nothing , which really shocked me.Gundogdu decided that further action was required, and shared his experience on Twitter and TikTok.Gundogdu said: I took it to Twitter and posted pictures on there until Burger King got back to me. They apologised and gave me a link to email them. It took days for them to get back to my email complaint, and all they did was apologise and offer me two free Whopper meals. I thought they were taking the p*ss. Burger Kingaposs response really shocked me, that it was just an apology. I told them about my mental health and how I didnapost eat for three days.  I emailed back saying aposyouaposve not taken my mental health or religion into considerationapos. Nobodyaposs done anything regarding the situation. This has % put me off going back. Iaposll never go back to Burger King again. At the time of his visit, Gundogdu admits he didnapost realise that Burger King didnapost serve halal meat - meaning the meat is not considered permissible under Islamic law - but says he is not a strict Muslim. Gundogdu said: A lot of people on my TikTok were telling me that Burger King isnapost really halal, which I didnapost really know about. I thought any meat that wasnapost pork was halal. Iaposm Muslim but Iaposm not really religious. I donapost pray, so I donapost really know a lot about it. My biggest shock came from how much bacon was on there. Even my friends were shocked. All of my friends sympathised and % of my TikTok comments were sympathetic, which surprised me. Itaposs sad because it feels like nobody is taking this seriously. Several TikTok users empathised with Gundogduaposs predicament. One wrote: Eventhe burger isnapost halal itaposs the principle. Another commented: Eating bacon is so traumatising. Youaposre not overreacting, I suffered too. Itaposs just unbearable, and the disbelief too. Other commenters werenapost as sympathetic and chastised Gundogdu for eating at Burger King in the first place. In his video, which has been viewed over , times, Gundogdu says: I was on my break, so I went to Burger King Airside to get a burger meal. So I ordered a double cheeseburger meal and I specically said aposNo baconapos twice to the cashier. Got my meal and went back to my crew-room to eat it on my break. So I bit my burger, first bite. Iaposm chewing it, but Iaposm thinking aposThis does not taste right at allapos.  for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information atwww.mirror email.Open the bun and find itaposs loaded with, full of bacon, yeah. And Iaposm  years old. Iaposve never ever ever eaten bacon in my entire le, and Iaposm never planning on eating bacon. Itaposs just for like religious reasons, itaposs just not in my thing and Iaposve never eaten it and never will, so that needs to be appreciated and respected, I believe, in my f**king way. So here are the pictures now. So first, I want to show you this, on the wrapper of the burger, theyaposve specically crossed this out, so no bacon. Thataposs my first proof and thataposs the first mistake that theyaposve done. Anyway...Iaposve obviously finished my chips, this is the burger that Iaposve obviously had first bite of it. And then until I realise, I find this on my burger. How  How  Can someone like explain this to me  It just doesnapost make sense. I just do not understand. But I do want to say that Iaposve not been eating anything for the past three days. Iaposve been physically sick, Iaposve been vomiting, Iaposve been having headaches. Because Iaposve never ever eaten it in my entire le, and I was never planning on eating it. This is absolutely ridiculous. So I do want to give a big shout-out to Burger King,youaposre going to watch this, because you will be tagged in this. You need your staff out, you need to let them know that they need to listen to simple instructions that they have been given by customers really. A spokesperson for SSP, who operate Burger Kingaposs Stansted airport branch, said: Weaposre committed to providing passengers with a great experience at our restaurants, and we’re sorry to have fallen short on this occasion. In light of this incident, we will be retraining our team and making sure all customised orders are double checked before they are served to help ensure it doesn’t happen again. We have been in contact with the customer to apologise directly. A spokesperson for Burger King said: Burger King UK understands the impact and upset this incident has caused Gundogdu Yuzudik and sincerely apologises for this unfortunate human error. Staff are trained to follow customer specications to ensure they can have their meal their way and we will be reinforcing our training at all restaurants, to guarantee mistakes like this are minimised. Burger King UK strives to deliver the best customer experience and highest-quality meals possible at all times. title: sainsburys john lewis ask shoppers
story: Sainsburys and John Lewis ask shoppers to keep wearing face masks despite rule changeSainsburys, John Lewis and Waitrose will ask customers in England to keep wearing face masks despite the Government scrapping plan B measures and their mask mandate from tomorrowJohn Lewis is among the group of leading stores that will continue asking staff and shoppers to wear face masks Image: Getty ImagesByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments Leading supermarkets will ask staff and customers to continue wearing face masks after plan B measures end tomorrow.Sainsburyaposs, John Lewis and Waitrose will remind shoppers to wear a covering in store despite the Government scrapping the rule as a legal requirement from Thursday. However, Morrisons has confirmed they will welcome maskless shoppers, BBC reports.The retailers said visitors wonapost be forced to wear masks, but they will be encouraged in order to keep staff and other people safe. Downing Street rolled out Plan B at the start of December to battle the surge of Omicron cases. The measures are being lted from tomorrow because the mutation has already peaked, the government has said. Though no longer a legal issue, the Government is still advising Brits to wear a mask in enclosed or crowded spaces, and when meeting strangers.  Retail worker trade union USDAW is also urging shoppers to observe Covid safety measures. Speaking to the broadcaster, Sainsburyaposs said safety was its highest priority. The supermarket plans to put up posters and remind customers over the tannoy about their guidance. In a statement, they said: In Scotland and Wales face coverings remain mandatory for those who can wear them in our stores, in line with the latest government restrictions.  We continue to have a range of safety measures in all of our stores, including screens and sanitising stations. Department store John Lewis, which owns Waitrose, will be suggesting people wear masks but say it will be down to iniduals to make a personal choice. Meanwhile, electronics store Currys will ask staff to wear masks in-store and while delivering products. But customers will not be expected to do so.  We will continue to assess our approach based on infection rates and colleague feedback, the company said. Usdaw, which represents , retail workers, said the Governmentaposs move to end the measure was deeply disappointing while infections rates remain high. General secretary Paddy Lillis said: We hope all retailers will continue to put staff and customer safety first. Wearing a face covering is an important measure to help protect workers who have no option but to interact with the public. Rail operators also plan to ask travellers to adhere to mask-wearing rules on their services.  Boris Johnson confirmed all Plan B measures will end tomorrow. This means that mandatory mask-wearing on public transport and in shops, work-from-home guidance and the need for Covid passes will all be axed, despite rates of Omicron infection still surging across the country. UK will revert to Plan A with a focus on vaccine rollout, with Health Secretary Sajid Javid warning last Wednesday that itaposs not the end of the road eventhe number of cases are falling.This means that the end of Plan B does not mean the end of restrictions altogether. title: school should scrap hair rules
story: School should scrap hair rules and let kids embrace their heritageAfter a ticking off at her sons school, Eva Simpson knows only too well how out-of-touch guidelines can be. And she applauds the St Albans headteacher who is ripping up the rulebookEva Simpson says schools should scrap their hair rulesImage: Getty ImagesopinionByEva Simpson:,  Jan | comments Like most parents on their child’s first day of ­ secondary school, I was filled with immense pride.My son looked so smart in his new unorm – blazer, tie, shirt, gleaming shoes. I took loads of pictures to show family and friends.When we arrived at the school, a teacher pointed to my son and called out “can this boy’s parent come and see me I stepped forward proudly. I didn’t expect to be singled out for how well turned out and smart my son looked on his first day of big school. “Good morning,” said the teacher. “I’m just wonderingyou read the school’s policy on hair  Your son’s haircut is in contravention of that.” I was stunned. Contravention. What was he on about My son had a perfectly normal hair cut, one that he’d had all through primary school. A short crop, similar to one sported by US President Barack Obama. But as far as the school was concerned it was an “extreme” haircut because it wasn’t a number four or above. In other words it was too short. I won’t lie, I was so upset I was on the verge of tears. Of course in typical British fashion I apologised profusely and assured him it wouldn’t happen again. But I was fuming. It immediately created a ­ision when there didn’t need to be one and left a very bad taste. There have been too many incidents of black children being penalised for hair ­“transgressions”. So I was heartened to read about St Albans headteacher Julie Richardson who has ripped up the school’s rule book on hair and thrown it out of the window.Now kids can come in with cornrows, Afros, short hair, whatever, without being put into isolation and missing valuable teaching time.Too many unorm policies around hair are ridiculous. They ignore children’s cultural heritage. Black schoolgirls for instance have sometimes been banned from having braids as they’re classed as hair extensions, even though they’re neat and mean the child can get ready for school much quicker. This fosters resentment, all to the detriment of the child. Part of the problem is the lack of ­ersity among school governors. It’s a closed shop. Many schools, especially those with a large black student body, have practically no black representation among the governing body and that needs to change. So I applaud Ms Richardson. I hope more schools take a leaf out of her book. title: socialite who became known lion
story: Socialite who became known as the Lion Man of Cha dies aged John Rendall and Anthony ‘Ace’ Bourke were flatmates who ran a furniture store. They came across a lion cub called Christian in the pet department of Harrods department store and bought the animalJohn Rendall and Anthony Bourke with Christian the lion in their London home Image: SHARED CONTENT UNITByDeborah Collcutt:,  Jan | commentsThe trio were as common a sight in seventies Cha as mini-skirts and Mary Quant eyeliner, driving around in a convertible Mercedes, dining in the finest restaurants and partying with glamorous women. And one of them was a lion. Christian the lion cub was famous among the bohemian and glamorous social world which congregated in that trendy part of south west London and included The Beatles, Mick Jagger, Jimi Hendrix and Vivienne Westwood, as well as his owners Anthony ‘Ace’ Bourke and John Rendall, whose death at the age of  was announced today. The Lion Man of Cha, as Rendall came to be known, and Bourke were flatmates who ran a furniture store, coincidentally called Sophistocat. They came across Christian in the pet department of Harrods department store, where back in the day you could buy tapirs, snakes, monkeys, pumas and even lions as well. This was before the Endangered Species Act of , which made it illegal for exotic creatures to be sold to the public. For the princely sum of  guineas – about £, in today’s money – Christian was theirs.  The men set about feeding Christian from a detailed diet sheet supplied by Harrods: raw egg and vitamins for breakfast, raw meat — usually chopped beef or rabbit — for lunch and supper, and, as a special treat, a delicious marrow-filled bone at night. Local restaurants and butchers offered steaks that were past their sell-by date, and cut-price meat. But exercise soon became a concern as Rendall and Bourke didn’t know where to walk him in this densely populated and traffic-choked corner of London. The local vicar came to their rescue when he offered Christian the use of a churchyard, near the shop. When he was nearly a year old, Christian had grown rapidly and his owners heartbreakingly decided they had to set him free. Lion expert George Adamson agreed to rehome him at Kora reserve in Kenya, so two weeks after Christian’s first and last birthday in England in August, , they headed for Africa. When they took Christian for his first walk in the bush, they witnessed the animal instincts that would ensure his survival. Spotting a lost cow in the bush, Christian instantly froze and began stalking his prey, stealthily creeping forwards. George was worried about the cow’s horns and told the men to grab Christian.  For the first time ever, the lion turned and snarled at them, leaving the pair profoundly shaken by the transformation in Christian from a biddable pet to a deadly hunter. Although sad that it was time to say goodbye, the pair were relieved to see he possessed the instincts he needed to stay alive. “Once we’d got him to Africa, I think Ace particularly had a real sense of, ‘my God, we’ve done it. Phew’.” said John years later. “But it was also sad: this wonderful presence had gone.” A year later, in the summer of , the men ed to Kora to see George and, they hoped, Christian. George warned them not to get their hopes up as Christian, now the head of a small pride, hadn’t been seen for weeks. But when they landed in Nairobi, George was beaming. “The lions turned up this morning,” he said. “Christian must have known you were coming.” The moment he heard his former owners’ voices, Christian ran towards them, grunting with excitement. Watching the lb lion bounding towards them at about  miles an hour was a breathtaking moment – would he greet or attack them  Bracing themselves, suddenly Christian was jumping up, rubbing their heads, and running backwards and forwards between them as he tried to embrace both men at the same time. He knew exactly who they were. The wonderful moment of reunion was captured on film and has since been watched more than  million views on YouTube. “I look at the photos of that meeting and realise how overwhelmed I was by the powerful emotion,” Rendall said in an interview. “At that moment, the gulf between humans and lions had been blurred by sheer euphoria.” Rendall, who was found dead in his study on Sunday by his magician son, Max, said in an interview once: “Christian changed my le forever and I will never forget him.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Daily MirrorLions,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: teen who faces internal decapitation
story: Exclusive: Teen who faces internal decapitation from rare condition cries as strangers gt £,Allesha Barnfield could become internally decapitated at any time due to a rare condition but after the Mirror helped her tell her story she is crying tears of joy and can fly to Spain for le saving surgeryAllesha is eagerly awaiting surgery in February to save her from this awful condition Image: The MirrorByHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A teenager has thanked strangers whose incredible generosity has funded brain surgery to stop a rare condition from internally decapitating her.Allesha Barnfield, , from Highfield, South Yorkshire was diagnosed with Chiari Malformation in September  but is not eligible for surgery on the NHS. The condition means that the ligaments in Allesha’s spine are tense and tighter than usual, subsequently pulling her brain into her spinal canal which causes crippling headaches making sound and light unbearable for the teen.The potentially fatal condition can also lead to ‘internal decapitation’ or paralysis when the tension builds so much that these ligaments become severed. The former law student, whose dreams of becoming a lawyer were initially dashed by the devastating diagnosis, needed £, to fly to Spain and have an innovative new operation which will stop the malformation in her spine. Have you got an incredible story to tell  Email webnews@mirror But following an exclusive Mirror appeal to help her raise the funds she has received an incredible £, from people around the world. Allesha said: “The surgery is booked, all I need to book now is my flights and work out who is going to come with me. “I’m literally so happy it’s unreal, I can’t believe it. “The Mirror is the reason this has all happened, I donapost know where I would be without all these amazing people who have donated and the help I have had to raise awareness.  “Thousands of people have donated, some of them I’ve never met. “I rang my sister crying when we hit £,. I’ve had to take the last few days just to process it. “I never thought I would even manage to raise the money I needed, never mind do it in a few days.” Allesha had started looking for answers three years ago when she was struck down with daily headaches so severe that she can’t bear to look at light or hear anything louder than a whisper. The teenager was forced to give up her placement with a law firm and quit college just as she was about to go to university, instead spending her le confined in a dark quiet room.  Now her surgery at the Filum System clinic in Barcelona is booked for February  and Allesha will be supported by her boyfriend, Kieran, . Although the recovery period ies between patients, Allesha hopes to be home and healthy in time for her th birthday in April, when her le can finally begin again. She said: “Hopefully I will be back up and better in time for my th birthday. “It’s the best birthday present I could ever ask for. “I want to go back and get ready for university and start studying law. “The next step is having the surgery and then taking the time to recover but I want to raise as much awareness as I can about Chiari Malformation. “Even though I’m terried I’m also so excited and feel like I have a new lease of le back. “Before this I just wanted to give up because I thought my le was over. “But now I have a chance to start again.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSTeenagers" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news uk-covid-cases-pass--"Coronavirus in numbers: UK registers further  deathsByAlice Peacock:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Britain has recorded , new Covid cases over the past  hours while  more deaths were confirmed within  days of a positive test.This is a .% increase on figures recorded last Wednesday. The latest figures mark an increase on the number of cases recorded this time last week, and mark a reversal on the downwards trend seen in infections following the New Year period.In recent days the number of new cases has hovered around the , mark after peaking at nearly , new cases in early January.Case numbers have substantially dropped since peaking around New Year’s - with , cases recorded on January . However, the lag between catching Covid and falling ill, and then falling seriously ill and dying, means death rates are spiking now. The UK recorded , cases yesterday and have once again increased today, suggesting the decline in cases has been brought to a halt.  The  deaths recorded over the  hours to Tuesday pm marked the highest number of deaths confirmed in one day since February  last year. New data suggests the Omicron strain caused unprecedented levels of coronavirus infection in England this month with the new iety almost completely replacing Delta.The highest prevalence was seen in primary school children at .%, while overall it was .% between January  and  this year. It means that during this period one in  people in England was infected with Covid. The latest figures come just hours before Covid Plan B measures are due to be axed in England tomorrow. This means that mandatory mask-wearing on public transport and in shops, work-from-home guidance and the need for Covid passes will all be axed, despite rates of Omicron infection still surging across the country.UK will revert to Plan A with a focus on vaccine rollout, with Health Secretary Sajid Javid warning last Wednesday that itaposs not the end of the road eventhe number of cases are falling.Work-from-home guidance ended last week, with people ing to offices almost immediately after it was axed. Similarly, face coverings are no longer a legal requirement in public spaces including transport and shops. Face masks will also no longer be required in classrooms. The scrapping of Covid tests required for travellers reentering the UK also signals the continuation of efforts to learn to live with Covid. The elimination of the tests, no longer needed from February , also led to a boom in bookings for people keen to escape for the February half-term of Easter break.Meanwhile the country is awaiting the publication of Sue Gray’s report into the ious Downing Street parties - which it’s thought could lead to the end of Boris Johnson’s leadership. The Met police yesterday confirmed they were investigating the number of potentially law-breaking ‘events’ thrown by No. throughout the pandemic.One of these ‘events’ was reportedly a surprise birthday party thrown for Boris Johnson which involved cake.Despite originally resisting calls to investigate any of the  reported parties which were thrown at ious stages during lockdown, Cressida Dick has confirmed that the police would look into the claims. The report by top civil servant Sue Gray has looked into the same events. title: vegan vows boycott subway mocking
story: Vegan vows to boycott Subway for mocking Veganuary with Steakuary flyersVegan activist Jamie Carter has vowed to botcott Subway, after the chain sent out flyers encouraging people to follow Steakuary and Turkeyuary as well as VeganuaryJamie has been vegan for two years and vegetarian for  before that Image: Kennedy News and MediaByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A vegan has vowed never to step foot in a Subway ever again, after the sandwich chain sent degrading flyers allegedly mocking Venganuary, by suggesting customers enjoy alternatives such as Steakuary and Turkeyuary.Livid Jamie Carter received the leaflet through his door at the beginning of the month, advertising a range of sub options suited to Veganuary, Tunauary, ChickenTeriyakiuary and B.M.T.uary, and other meaty month names. Iaposm not happy, I felt disappointed. I thought I might fancy a Subway so went to seethey had any offers in the leaflet. I turned it over and to my dismay I felt they were making a mockery of Veganuary, Jamie, from Norwich, said. Iaposve never seen any company, let alone such a big one, make a mockery of Veganuary. They include so many meats like aposSteakuaryapos or aposTurkeybreastuary, it was just a marketing opportunity for them  Iaposd rather they just promoted Veganuary, it was unnecessary to add all the other terms. This should be a time of promoting a more ethical option. I was just pretty dumbfounded. Iaposve never seen any other wording like that. Iaposll happily boycott them now.The -year-old, who has been a vegan for two years and was previously vegetarian for  years, took to Facebook to vent about the absolute p***take pamphlet to his followers, who branded it pathetic and f***ing vile.Subway UK  Ireland very disappointed with you making a mockery of Veganuary, he wrote. Posting a leaflet promoting people to eat whoever they want instead of promoting a cruelty-free compassionate option. SHAME ON YOU. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Now the animal rights activist has vowed to boycott Subway despite having at least  within walking distance of his home as he feels the chain have undone their efforts to support plant-based eating. Jamie said: This is a month where it should really be hitting home that thereaposs other tasty options. I posted it online to seeanyone  had the same feelings as me, and an awful lot of people do. That was the first time Iaposve ever addressed a big company directly and Iaposve still not had a response from them. Itaposs a leaflet with six vouchers inside - only one of which is for their plant-based section. The rest apply to any of their meat or dairy products. Other than the post, people have been contacting me [privately]. The general consensus is that people arenapost happy. I do generally speak to like-minded people and they think itaposs degrading to the cause. I thought [Subway] had made a step in the right direction by bringing out plant-based options and theyaposve done a  now. Itaposs like theyaposve undone their efforts so far. After posting online, Jamie received a number of responses from unamused followers who agreed it wasnapost the best move for the sandwich chain. Pathetic. Wouldnapost go there anyway, one wrote, while another added: F***ing vile to use the Veganuary word and [to] add flesh aposfleshanuaryapos it is literally taking the p***. I’m pleased I’m no regular at this place. This poster is not funny, a third wrote, while a fourth commented: They can stuff it! Iaposll make my own rolls and a lot cheaper too. Subway was contacted for comment.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news uk-news widow-tears-shes-reunited-dog-"Cheshire: Care home resident reunited with her pet dogByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsWhen Diana Darlingtonaposs beloved husband Roy passed away last year, she made the tough decision to leave their memory-filled home to move closer to family. But moving from Kent to Cheshire meant she also had to say a heartbreaking goodbye to her dog Jak, who had been a gt from Roy  years ago. The -year-old left the Bichon-Lakeland terrier mix with a relative who lived more than  miles away, which meant she didnapost get to see him very often. After hearing the story, staff at her care home hatched a plan to find him a local home so she would still get to see him. And before long employee Claire Dunnettaposs sister, Sarah Roberts, came to the rescue and adopted him - and Diana and Jak have now been reunited.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Diana had the surprise of her le when she was told by staff at Redwalls Nursing Home, Sandiway, Cheshire, that they had found Jak a home nearby. Now with Jak being so close, he is able to pop in and see Diana every few days. Diana, retired hotel owner, said: I couldnapost believe it. Itaposs a miracle. Jak leapt up at me from the door and jumped on me and we had cuddles and kisses. Itaposs just like old times.  Regional activities coordinator Jodie Solaiman, , and relatives had seen how distraught Diana was at being so far away from her -year-old dog and put out a plea to rehome him somewhere local. Luckily local Sarah Roberts jumped at the chance to make a dference and travelled to pick him up from Kent the next day. Sarah said: As soon as I heard about Jodie looking to home Jak closer to Diana I just thought, aposIaposll have him. Iaposm local so I can pop to Redwalls any time and the dference it will make to Diana is immeasurable!apos So much so, my children and I travelled to Kent the next day to collect Jak and the reunion was so happy and emotional that I knew I had made the right decision. Diana was very surprised when she found out the news. When I told Diana that weaposd found Jak a home just five minutes away she couldnapost believe it, Jodie said. She was in tears with happiness. Jodie also managed to capture the moment the pair were reunited for the first time in over a year. An excited Jak jumps up onto Dianaaposs lamp straight away after seeing her. Diana said: We fell asleep together after. I needed him. He got me through so much. Now Jak is able to come into see Diana two to three times a week. The Mirror is committed to more hopeful news. We recognise the news agenda can sometimes feel overwhelmingly negative.And while itaposs our job to keep you informed and hold those in power to account, we are making a commitment to also report more hopeful news. We will celebrate the people, places and movements that are bringing good into the world and, more than that, we will dig beneath the surface of important issues with the aim of finding hope.We will be firm in our convictions - but always fair-minded. By sharing solutions to problems, we can do more good and feel better about the world around us. Because we believe you deserve it. #mirrormorehopefulFollow on Twitter @mirrormorehope And follow Mirror More Hopeful on Facebook Jodie said: Itaposs made such a dference to her mood. Sheaposs putting make-up on again. She has a dog bed in her room for him when he comes to visit. Itaposs been amazing seeing the change in her. I just feel so lucky, Diana said. Iaposm so grateful for Redwalls for letting this happen.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: woman cant use fiances sperm
story: Woman cant use fiances sperm for IVF as he didnt give permission before sudden deathEllie Horne, , fears she will lose the chance forever to have partner Myles children - a shared dream of the couple before he died from pneumonia last September after a y battle with leukaemiaMyles sadly died from pneumonia last September after a y battle with leukaemia Image: GoFundMeByBen Turner:,  Jan | comments A grieving woman has lost her bid to use her dead fianceaposs frozen sperm for IVF - because he didnapost give permission before his sudden death.Ellie Horne, , fears she will lose the chance forever to have partner Mylesapos children - a shared dream of the couple.Myles sadly died from pneumonia last September after a y battle with leukaemia.Ellie said: I am now facing a very long and costly court case to win legality over Mylesapos stored semen, something that should be rightly mine. Not only have I lost the love of my le the man who I built a le with, planned to marry and carry his children, I am at the brink of losing the chance to ever even have our children. Ellie, who has taken Mylesapos surname despite not being married, is preparing for a £, high court battle to win the right to use his sperm.  The couple had been together for three years and Myles froze his sperm after doctors warned cancer treatment could render him infertile. They had started IVF treatment but Ellie, from Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, said it was pushed back due to the Covid pandemic. Mylesapos health declined rapidly last year after a series of infections - but Ellie said his death last September was unexpected. Now, Ellie claims that experts never told the couple that Myles needed to sign a consent form for her to use his sperm in case he died.  Ellie said: As the law stands, he needed to sign a consent form for me to use his sperm after he passed away. Nobody told us this. We had no idea. Had we known, he would most definitely have signed. Weaposd talked so much about the baby we wanted to have. If it was a boy we planned to call him Mylo, after Myles. If itaposs a girl we wanted to call her Nora, after my nan.Ellie has ploughed her savings into the court battle and is fundraising £, to help with legal costs.The GoFundMe page can be found here: Losing my Fiancé  Fighting Rights to Start Family, organised by Ellie Horne Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Court caseIVFFertilityLeukaemia" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: youre most likely catch covid
story: Where youre most likely to catch Covid from gym to cinema, new study showsA new study has highlighted the exact risk you have of catching Covid- in ious locations – including where youre most likely to catch itHeavy exercise indoors can increase your risk of catching Covid Image: Getty ImagesByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments There are certain things we do in our daily lives that increase the risk of catching Covid-. Two years into the coronavirus pandemic, normal le is slowly ing in England, with the easing of restrictions and rules. Despite Covid rates increasing thanks to the Omicron iant, the hospital admission rate has decreased. Even so, itaposs important to do all we can to avoid spreading Covid. Itaposs well known that certain places and activities can increase our risk, but a new study has offered clear estimates about the risk of Covid infection.So which activities are safe, and how safe exactly are they  Researchers have published a study in the peer-reviewed Environmental Science  Technology journal calculated the exact risk of catching Covid in ious environments. Where youaposre most likely to catch Covid  Displayed in a handy chart, the study has lists the percentage likelihood of becoming infected in dferent situations. For example,youaposre sitting in a crowded cinema with a mostly unmasked audience, thereaposs a % chance of being infected, assuming everyone in the room is silent. However,there are some people talking, the odds of infection jump to %. If the audience is masked, the risk of infection drops to a mere .%they stay silent, or %there is talking. Unsurprisingly, the risk of catching Covid is lowest in outdoor areas, and the risk is loweredpeople stay silent and wear a mask.  For example,youaposre standing with someone outside for a short period of time, and neither of you are talking, there is less than .% likelihood of catching Covid outdoors. If itaposs in a poorly ventilated area, the risk creeps up to .%. If youaposre wearing a face covering but speaking for a short time to someone who is infected, there is a .% chance of you getting Covid. If the area is poorly ventilated, there is a .% chance, according to the study. The chance of catching Covid increasesthe place has a high volume of people. Brits will be well aware of the three main symptoms of coronavirus – a new, continuous cough, a fever and a loss of taste and or smell. These are the officially recognised symptoms according to the NHS. However, with the new Omicron iant, symptoms have been described as being more similar to a common cold. Itaposs important to be aware of the symptoms in order to limit the spread of Covid. most common symptoms of Omicron, overtaking the  aposclassicapos Covid symptoms Is a rash a symptom of Omicron  Is altered taste a symptom of Omicron  Warning in your eyes doctor warns could be sign of Omicron Warning signs that the Omicron symptoms youaposre experiencing arenapost mind Omicron symptoms parents may be able to spot in children  least pleasant Omicron symptom – including dizziness  According to the chart, you have a % chance of catching Covidyouaposre doing heavy exercise in a poorly ventilated, high occupancy indoor area,youaposre not wearing a face covering and have contact for a long time. The study explains thatyou do a combination of things that are in the dark red cells of the table, youaposre more likely to get Covid. The things that increase your risk are:Gathering together with lots of people in an enclosed space with poor air quality, such as an under-ventilated gym, nightclub or school classroom Doing something strenuous or rowdy such as exercising, singing or shouting Leaving off your masks Staying there for a long timeTo avoid catching Covid, the study recommends keeping in the green or amber spaces of the table.  That means: If you must meet other people, do so outdoors or in a space that’s well-ventilated or meet in a space where the ventilation is good and air quality is known.Keep the number of people to a minimum Spend the minimum possible amount of time together Don’t shout, sing or do heavy exercise Wear high-quality, well-fitting masks from the time you enter the building to the time you leaveThe study stresses that while the chart gives an estimated figure for each situation, the actual risk will depend on the specic parameters, such as exactly how many people are in a room of what size. The study was completed by Trish Greenhalgh, Professor of Primary Care Health Sciences, University of Oxford Jose-Luis Jimenez, Distinguished Professor, Chemistry, University of Colorado Boulder Shelly Miller, Professor of Mechanical Engineering, University of Colorado Boulder, and Zhe Peng, Research Scientist, University of Colorado Boulder. news us-news harry-meghans-netflix-silence-spoty-"Prince Harry and Meghan Markle sign exclusive podcast deal with SpotyByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments When Prince Harry and Meghan Markle stepped down as senior royals, they pledged to become financially independent. And one of the first big-money commercial deals they signed in September  was with streaming giant Netflix, which is reportedly worth around £million.However, almost  months on from the big announcement, Netflix has yet to release any content produced by the couple. It mirrors a similar deal theyaposve signed with Spoty for £million to produce podcasts for the  - but apart from a trailer and one  minute episode, there has been no other output.Yesterday, it was reported that Spoty was taking the deal into its own hands by hiring a number of in-house producers to help deliver on the deal after waiting more than a year for any material. So could it be that Netflix will do the same  Here we take a look... aposPowerful storytellingapos Harry and Meghanaposs deal with Netflix was formally announced on September , , in one of their first business ventures away from the Royal Family.Itaposs never been confirmed exactly how much the deal is worth - but reports put it at around million. In a statement at the time, the pair said: Our lives, both independent of each other and as a couple, have allowed us to understand the power of the human spirit, of courage, resilience and the need for connection.  Through our work with erse communities and their environments, to shining a light on people and causes around the world, our focus will be on creating content that informs but also gives hope. As new parents, making inspirational family programming is also important to us, as is powerful storytelling through a truthful and relatable lens. Meanwhile, Ted Sarandos, chief content officer at Netflix, said: Harry and Meghan have inspired millions of people all around the world with their authenticity, optimism and leadership. We’re incredibly proud they have chosen Netflix as their creative home – and are excited about telling stories with them that can help build resilience and increase understanding for audiences everywhere. Speaking in a bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey, Harry said deals with the streaming giants were never part of the plan, but said they needed cash to pay for security. He said: That was suggested by somebody  by the point of where my family literally cut me off financially, and I had to afford security for us. Upcoming shows  Although no programmes have made it to screens, details of several shows Harry and Meghan have been working on have been released.In April , it was revealed a documentary called Heart of Invictus was in the works - with Harry saying he couldnapost be more excited for it. The series will focus on injured or ill service members around the globe preparing for the  Invictus Games at The Hague, The Netherlands. The episodes will chart the journey of the competitors as they train up, the organisers as they set to work making the planned games a reality, and also the national teams working with both sides for the delayed games in the Spring.Meanwhile, last July, it was announced Meghan would be acting as an executive producer on an animated series about a young girlaposs adventures.It has the working title Pearl and the young character will be inspired by a iety of influential women from throughout history. Other executive producers include Elton Johnaposs husband David Furnish, Carolyn Soper, and Emmy Award-winning filmmakers Liz Garbus and Dan Cogan. No air date has been given for the show. Fly-on-the-wall documentary   When Harry and Meghanaposs Netflix deal was announced, it was speculated that the pair could feature in their own fly-on-the-wall-style documentary.However, this was swtly denied by the Sussexes, with their spokesperson telling Hello:The Duke and Duchess are not taking part in any reality shows. But last September, it was reported that Harry was spotted with a mic during his and Meghanaposs tour of New York.The black wire could be seen sticking out his trouser pocket and into his shirt and it has been suggested the couple may have been recording content for their Netflix deal. Hiring help Now it appears that Netflix is on the look out for a Los Angeles-based production designer to work on the Pearl project.According to MailOnline, the job ad posted on social media states the person will help to develop, create and support the aesthetic vision of the executive producer team.The job ad also states: The ideal candidate will need to be someone who can collaborate with grace, humility, inclusion and open-mindedness. news us-news im---stuck-eight-"Woman opens up on being ‘stuck in the body of an eight-year-old’ByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A young woman who looks like a child due to a rare condition said she is sick of people tutting as she walks down the street - as they judge her mother for letting her wear makeup.Shauna Rae is  but people regularly think she is an eight-year-old, as when she was a baby she was diagnosed with brain cancer. The treatment of the disease damaged her pituitary gland, leaving it nearly inactive, so now she stands at just ft, even though she is the age of a fully-grown woman. Sheaposs now spoken out saying how upsetting le can be, as people judge her for not dressing like a child or for wearing make up, and they even approach her mother and criticise her parenting. What do you think of Shaunaaposs bravey  Let us know in the comments...Shauna is starring in a TLC documentary called I Am Shauna Rae, and in the showaposs advert, she said: If you were to look at me, you would think Iaposm just a normal little girl, doing normal little girl things with my fun, crazy family. But the truth is Iaposm not a little girl. Iaposm a woman, a -year-old woman stuck in the body of an eight-year-old.The channel also shared a clip from the show on TikTok, @tlctv, which includes an interview with Shauna and her mum, Patty Schrankel.  Patty said: Shauna likes to dress up, like any other -year-old, but we go out together and she gets looks like aposoh wow, what is she doing  What is that kid doing apos Then I get the looks of aposhow could you  How could you let your child dress like this  And the negative comments have an impact on Shauna, even though theyaposre not directed at her. Shauna said: My mum has to explain that Iaposm old enough to make my own decisions, but they donapost believe her - they call her a liar. So thataposs not fun. I feel horrible for my mum because I donapost deal with all the backlash, they donapost think itaposs appropriate to come up to a child and say these things - they think itaposs appropriate to come up to the mother which isnapost appropriate at all, in my opinion. And I know it affects her.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. After the clip was shared on TikTok, many people commented their support of Shauna - saying she was brave to speak out. One said: This ladyaposs situation is heartbreaking. Sheaposs a -year-old woman wanting all the things a -year-old wants and needs to do. Then another wrote: She is very mature. Talk to her and itaposs quite obvious she is not a child. And a third commented: Can we talk about how beautul that girl is  Look at her eyes!Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: mum who lost half tongue
story: Mum who lost half her tongue to cancer feels positive with new one made from her legCameron Newsom, , was happy and healthy when she first developed a white spot on her tongue which led to a stage four skin cancer diagnosisCameron Newsom, , first developed a white spot on her tongue Image: Cameron Newsom   SWNSByHarrison MooreKirstie McCrumLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Jan | commentsA mum who lost half of her tongue to cancer has said she is feeling really positive after getting a new one made from her own leg. Cameron Newsom, , first developed a white spot on her tongue and was referred by her dentist to the local hospital for a biopsy. The spot was not painful and, when the results came back negative for any signs of cancer, she and her husband Anthony, also , and their son Hudson, , were told not to worry.But a year later, Cameron, from Colorado Springs, Colorado, developed another identical spot and was admitted to hospital again for a deeper, more invasive biopsy, Bristol Live reports. The results once again showed no signs of cancer but medical experts couldnapost identy the cause of the spots.  Months later, her tongue became sensitive and sore, and immediately contacted her dentist. She was given antibiotics to combat any potential infection but her condition continued to worsen, as the original spots had transformed into a pinkish tumour on the left side of her tongue. She was sent for further tests and a third biopsy and after being referred to an ear nose and throat specialist, Cameron was diagnosed with stage four squamous cell carcinoma – skin cancer of the tongue. Cameron said: At the time of my diagnosis Iaposd lost over seven pounds because I was unable to eat or drink. It took three years from when the first spot originally appeared for doctors to finally diagnose me - no one ever mentioned it could be oral cancer. When I was told, it seemed like I was being handed a death sentence there and then, but straight away my reaction was Iaposm ready to fight this. I was  at the time and in very good shape, so I couldnapost understand why this was happening to me.  When I got home that day I googled my type of cancer and as you can imagine the results were absolutely terrying. There were images of people after having their jaws removed or sawed in half - Iaposd never been so scared. Cameronaposs diagnosis came in May  and she was scheduled in for three rounds of chemo, starting in July and finishing in September that year. Throughout that time, she was unable to eat or drink anything without suffering excruciating pain - all whilst undergoing grueling cancer treatment. There would be times at the dinner table where I would just burst into tears because I couldnapost eat a thing, she said.results showed no signs of cancer - but medical experts couldnapost identy the cause of the spots. Hudson, who was five at the time, didnapost know why I was always so upset and it got to the point where I couldnapost physically speak to him or my husband. A low point for me was when I went to a party with all my closest friends and I had to leave because my mouth was in so much pain. I went home and took a shower to calm down, and thataposs when clumps of my hair started falling out - it was so upsetting. Thankfully for Cameron, her chemotherapy was successful and as a result the tumor had shrunk a considerable amount. Her body had reacted well to the treatment, but the next part of her recovery was to have the tumor completely removed. She then flew back and forth to the MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, Texas to meet with some of the best oral surgeons in the country and organise the operation. On December , Cameron went under the kne, and oral and plastic surgeons worked together to remove the left side of her tongue. In what was a nine-and-a-half hour operation, they then replaced that part of her tongue with skin and muscle tissue from her thigh. Surgeons then performed a Tracheotomy on Cameron, where they sliced a hole between her two collar bones and inserted a tube into her neck so she could breathe. The mum also had a feeding tube taped to her nose so she could ingest vital calories which were desperately needed to help her body recover. Read More Cameron said: They usually take skin from your forearm, but I’m only five foot two, so I didn’t have enough skin on my forearm to replace what I was having removed. However, Iaposve been an athlete all my le, and there was plenty for them to use from my thigh - so thataposs what we decided to do. The oral surgeon removed part of my tongue, and the plastic surgeon took muscle and skin from my thigh to replace it. When I woke up I had tubes coming out my neck and nose which allowed me to breathe and eat. The next few weeks were hell because my mouth was so swollen I couldnapost swallow or breathe unassisted. I had to be under constant observation and every time my throat had a build up of blood and body fluid, it had to be flushed away using water. That was basically like being waterboarded by the nurses once or twice a day which was absolutely horric. The weirdest part of the whole experience was when I felt a rough texture on the thigh part of my tongue - and when I looked in the mirror it had started growing leg hair! For nine weeks after her surgery, Cameron underwent  rounds of radiation and another three rounds of chemo to rid of any remaining cancer cells. In that time she was unable to speak, and for six months had to use a tube inserted in her stomach to eat and drink whilst her wounds healed. From then on, Cameron started getting used to le with her new tongue - which included relearning how to speak, chew, drink and swallow. I had to teach myself how to speak again after the radiation therapy which was a really bizarre feeling, she said. I can only taste on the right side of my tongue which is the real side, and only chew on the right side because the left is attached to my gums. My manners are terrible because food sometimes just falls out my mouth, and when food gets stuck underneath my tongue it feels like having a small rock in your shoe. Because the left side is sewn to my gums I donapost have the full range of motion I used to which can be frustrating. A feeling I could compare it to is like having a dead arm or dead leg all the time - it is constantly tingly and numb. Only the healthy side produces saliva and I cant stick my tongue out my mouth at all, so licking things is a big no no! Itaposs now been nine years since my diagnosis and thereaposs been no signs of regression. The longer you go without regressing the less likely it is the cancer will come back, so were all feeling really positive.  was the toughest year of my le and I couldnapost of done it without the support of my amazing Antony and the rest of my family. In June , once she proved she could eat and drink unaided, Cameron ed to her job as a gymnastics coach and was finally able to start living le again. She has since mentored several other people whoaposve been diagnosed with the same cancer as she was, offering them support and guidance throughout their treatment. news us-news woman-says-shes-sick-after-"Pennsylvania: Lab monkeys escape from truck after crashBySam Elliott-Gibbs:,  Jan | comments A woman who helped lab monkeys thinking they were cats after a truck carrying the creatures crashed fears she may have picked up an illness.Michelle Fallon says one of the  escaped animals spat at her - and she has been sick since pulling over to help. After the vehicle ran into trouble, some of the crates broke after spilling out and it allowed many of the caged monkeys to run free. She approached one before it hissed at her and the woman from Pennsylvania, US, says she’s been experiencing ‘pink eye’ symptoms since the incident last week. She was also reported an inflammation of the eyeball and a cough and believes she may have caught something following the road accident.  Now Mrs Fallon has begun a course of antiviral drugs and treatment to prevent rabies. Following the rescue mission, she became alarmed after hearing officials warn the public not to approach the escaped monkeys as they could be carrying infectious diseases. She told news outlet WBRE: “I thought I was just doing the right thing by helping. “I was close to the monkeys, I touched the crates, I walked through their faeces so I was very close. So I called to inquire, you know, was I safe ”  Since the incident, the animal lover says she has experienced a number of symptoms.She wrote on Facebook : “What a day! I tried to help out at an accident and was told there were cats in the crates. So I went over to pet them only to find out it was monkeys.Then I noticed that there was three in each, with some completely broken, so I knew four had got away.  “I came home to go to bed and my aunt ran into a news crew and she found out not to get too close to the monkey. Well, I tried to pet one. I touched the crates and walked in poop. I was told meet the police at the scene to talk about exposure. “I spoke with the police and a woman from the CDC. I am getting a letter and Iaposm very low risk for I donapost know what yet. But my symptoms are covid symptoms. Like seriously. A day from hell!” Mrs Fallon visited a hospital where she was told by medics to closely monitor her health for the next month in case she develops any infectious diseases. The monkeys that managed to escape and go on the run were later captured and euthanised. news weird-news couple-uncover-restore-pool-hasnt-"Canada: Ontario couple restore disused swimming poolByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA couple has gone viral on TikTok after they posted a video renovating their pool that was abandoned  years ago. Andrew Pougnet and his we Sabrina Pougnet, both  from Ontario, Canada, moved into their home in June  and discovered the pool that hadnapost been used for around two decades. It was covered with decking and during that time, it had slowly filled with debris and rainwater, causing it to develop its own ecosystem at the bottom, like a lake. We started renovations on the home the day we got the keys, Sabrina said. We finished almost the entire main floor before working up the courage to tackle the in-ground pool this past summer.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. We had learned from the original owner when we bought the home that it would take a lot of work to get the pool up and running and ultimately restore it to its previous glory days. The couple were told by neighbours that it had been around  years since the pool had last been in use, which made them consider getting some extra help. Sabrina said: Initially we had reached out to local pool companies to seewe could hire someone to restore it for us, as neither of us had any experience, but our emails went unanswered likely due to the high demand for pools due to covid. Andrew and I didn’t knowthe pool structure would even be salvageable until the deck was removed - as it sat for so many years collecting rainwater and debris with a damaged liner. Finally, we decided to try restoring it ourselves and share the process as a series on our TikTok account. After Andrew, who works as a carpenter, and Sabrina, who is a recreation therapist, removed the deck, the couple could immediately see the rust on the walls they had feared. She added: We were worried that the pool may be too damaged to try restoring,that was the case, it was about to be the shortest TikTok series ever! Luckily for us, after draining the water and cleaning out the debris, we could see that the pool structure was salvageable, aside from minor surface rust which Andrew removed to prepare for a new liner. We knew it was going to be full of water and that there was a good chance of many dead critters and debris. However, we were surprised by the lack of smell, you would think that having a swamp of a pool for so many years, the smell would be unbearable, but it really didn’t smell at all! Even after draining the water to expose the ecosystem at the bottom of the pool, the smell was comparable to that of seaweed at a beach - a little fishy but not that bad. The couple completed the entire restoration in just over one month, starting in mid-July  and finishing in September . The work cost a total of ,to complete but they now have a safe pool to enjoy. They shared the restoration on TikTok, creating a series that showed their work on the old pool, with the first post racking up more than  million views and two million likes. Viewers were left ided by the outcome – with many saying they couldnapost step foot in there after seeing it filled with dirt and debris. One person said: I’d never step in that pool no matter how clean it is after. Y’all brewing covd  in there, another user joked. Someone  commented: I just know the smell coming out from under that deck was NASTY! So glad y’all made it awesome!!!. IMAGINE FALLING INTO THAT IF THE DECK BROKE OMG, exclaimed another. title: i pal pregnant before trying
story: I let pal get pregnant before trying for a baby - now she wont celebrate my bumpA mum has been left fuming after her friend failed to make a big deal out of her pregnancy, as she had expected her to send her flowers and plan her baby showerThe woman showered her friend with love every day after her pregnancy newsImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Jan | commentsFor many women trying to have children, finding out that youaposre expecting is one of the happiest days of your le - and one you want to share with all your loved ones.But one mum was left disappointed when she didnapost get the excited response she was expecting from her best pal after announcing she was pregnan t with her second child. Sharing her story anonymously on Mumsnet, the woman explained her friend is also currently pregnant and when her announcement was made, she splashed out on flowers and apregnancy hamper and began calling her every day to see how she was getting on.When the mum then fell pregnant a few months after her friend, she expected her tothe favour and be just as excited for her - but so far, she has been consciously not celebrating the womanaposs pregnancy news. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She said: My best friend found out she was pregnant last Autumn after trying for a year. I was so thrilled for her, I sent flowers the day after she told me the news, made her a pregnancy hamper, showered her with love, and checked in on her every day to see how she was getting on. I askedsheaposd be happy for me to think about baby showers for her when sheaposs further along and started sharing ideas with her. Once my friend conceived I told her that I wanted to start trying and she was very supportive. She knew I was holding off for her to get pregnant, as I already have a toddler who I conceived straight away so thought it could possibly happen again. She was fine up until I conceived in the first cycle and told her I was due two months after her. She seemed in shock that I was pregnant and I think some of it could be that it was so quick for us in comparison to her journey. The mum said she feels disappointed that her friend hasnapost made any effort to check in on her, and said that while she would usually make a big deal out of important events, she seems uninterested in her pregnancy.  She added: A few months on, despite me still checking in on her almost every day, she doesnapost ask how Iaposm doing orany of the love and support I give her. I donapost expect gts like the ones I gave her, but as an example, weaposre planning a meal out as a big group and I askedshe had any cravings or aversions so we could decide around that, but she didnapost ask about me. Sheaposs the type of person who would normally make a big deal about this , so feels like sheaposs consciously not celebrating my pregnancy. This is my best friend of  years so I was expecting her to be excited weaposd be on Mat leave together and experience this together. But commenters on the Mumsnet post were baffled by the mum, as many of them said she was being over the top and putting too much pressure on her friend - especially when sheaposs also going through her own pregnancy journey. One person wrote: You are very over the top. It would make me very uncomfortablemy friends reacted like that to a pregnancy announcement. While another said: I think your friend is probably feeling somewhat smothered, and maybe you should back off a bit. Sheaposs probably fine, and thinks you are too. And a third added: As lovely as your intentions are, it all sounds a bit suffocating to me personally. Also, it sounds like this is your friendaposs first pregnancy and your second one  So youaposve been through all this before, why do you need special handholding the second time around  I understand wanting a bit of support, but it all just sounds a bit intense and needy.What do you think  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON PregnancyUmm what Parenting" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: i refuse give unborn baby
story: I refuse to give my unborn baby my husbands surname - his family are furiousA mum-to-be has sparked a debate online after confessing she wouldnt be naming her unborn child after her husbands surname, despite having previously agreed to when they marriedThe mum-to-be regrets the agreement she made with her husband Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments An expectant mum has come under fire online after announcing she refused to give her unborn son her husbandaposs surname. Despite it being traditional for wives and children to take on the manaposs last name, the mum-to-be decided against this when she married her hubby three years ago.At the time, however, they came to an agreement that any future children would take on his name, to appease his traditional family - but with their first child on the way, the woman has now grown to regret her decision.When I married my husband I kept my maiden name which he was perfectly okay with. We already discussed this and agreed that any future kids we have will automatically take his last name. His family considers this huge deal and I decided to keep to just go with it, she wrote on Redditaposs AITA forum.But recently I started thinking about it a lot more and figured that it would be unfair for my unborn son to take my husbandaposs family name and not mine. I talked to my family and they said my husband and in-laws are ridiculous to push this on me without a compromise expecting I go with it.  The woman went home and told her husband sheaposd changed her mind about their childaposs last name, and had decided she wanted their son to have their surnames combined, or she would be changing his name to hers. He was confused saying we had an agreement and then asked what was the cause of this sudden change of mind. I told him and he said I canapost just do that and called me selfish when I pointed out that Iaposm the mother I get a say too, she continued. We went back and forth on this and he said no way he and his family will let me do this to his son, asmy last name is a disgrace. We had a fight and we stopped talking after this. He said that I broke and violated my part of the deal and I should just aposdealapos with it now but I wonapost accept it. The woman then turned to Reddit to question whether others also agreed with her husband, or whether they thought she too made a valid point. You literally mention that you’ve had this promise at least since you were married and have both discussed and agreed! He is right to be upset knowing you have already agreed and it’s a big deal to his family, which you are aware of, one Reddit user commented. It must be out of nowhere for him, yes you are the we and future mum but that doesn’t mean you can just switch sides and go back on your word whenever you feel like it. Meanwhile another added: Hyphenated is a reasonable compromise, but you’re still an a**hole for agreeing to give them his name and going back on it now that it’s time to follow through on your word.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: man finds nightmarish grim reaper
story: Man finds nightmarish Grim Reaper ice figures outside his homeA Canadian man has shared photographs of two very foreboding-looking ice figures he spotted outside his lakehouse, and its absolutely not the sort of thing youd want to encounter on a dark, lonely night. Image: Jam Press Ben TucciByJulia BanimRia Newman:,  Jan | comments A man from Ontario, Canada has gone viral after sharing images of two sinister-looking ice figures outside of his home, both of which bear a striking resemblance to the Grim Reaper. Ben Tucci, , was surprised by the ominous formations which had appeared outside his Lake Erie lakehouse in the town of Dunnville and shared a series of striking photographs on Facebook.Benaposs Facebook friends couldnapost help but shudder at the sight of the tall, humanoid figures, clad in what appears at first glance to be floor- white cloaks. The chilling vision, described as the stuff of nightmares by one follower, brings to mind the personied figure of death himself: the Grim Reaper.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Ben said: My initial reaction was one of awe. I couldnapost believe my eyes. On the first formation, I thought this is Jack Frost, Old Man Winter, Father Christmas, or perhaps even the Grim Reaper. My immediate reaction to the dejected looking figure was of an eerie looking woman or a sea hag of sorts, leaving the property almost asto be walking away from Jack Frost.He believes that the spectral figures do have an everyday sort of explanation. Water from the lake’s waves has recently landed on his next-door neighbour’s lamp post, thus creating the two menacing aposvisitorsapos Ben has since nicknamed Jack Frost and Grim Reaper. However, in a further unsettling twist to the tale, after Ben showed his daughter the photographs, she recognised the looming figures as being “spirits” that she believes have been visiting her in her dreams. Ben continued: “My youngest daughter had previously told us that she would have nightmares when sleeping in her lakeside bedroom in the old cottage – such that sheaposd sleep on the couch at times. When I showed her the pics of the ice formations she was stunned. She told me that the dejected-looking figure with head bowed was the image she had been tormented by in her dreams. Interestingly, Benaposs daughter hasnapost experienced such nighttime visitations at their new home, which he views as being almost like the old cottage was inhabited by a spirit which departed after the demolition. The photos have since been liked on Facebook more , times, clocking up hundreds of alarmed and fascinated comments. One person remarked, “If the Angel of Death looks like this when he she comes to get me, I’d be running on water away from it, while another shivered, I’m just saying thatI lived near there, I wouldn’t be sleeping for the rest of the winter.Have you had a strange or unusual encounter  Email us at yourmirror@mirrorRead MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON SnowGhosts" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: Man stuns with tour of smallest flat in NYC - with no room for oven or bathroomA man took to TikTok to prove to a fellow New Yorker that his apartment is much smaller than theirs in a video that has been viewed more than . million timesRon showed people on TikTok his apartment Image: @ronervin   TikTokByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsBesides its incredible architecture, flashy Broadway performances and yellow cabs, New York City is notoriously known for its small living spaces and absurdly high rent. But fans of comedian and actor Ron Ervin were still left stunned after watching a video tour of his teeny tiny flat, which is so small it wonapost fit a Queen-size bed. And there is another key element missing - an oven - so Ron has been In a viral TikTok video, a man has given everyone a full tour of his place to show the reality of living in the city, and itaposs left people stunned.Comedian and actor Ron Ervin @ronervinshared his video in response to another viral clip shared by TikToker Axel Webber, who claimed to have the smallest apartment in New York.He was quick to prove Webber wrong, as he said: Surprise b***h, a challenger has appeared. If I brought a queen-sized mattress into my New York apartment, it would crush me to death. He then proceeds to give a -degree tour of his apartment, as he says: Right, grand tour, everybody ready  This is my front door. Stay with me, stay with me, stay with me, stay with me, you still with me  Still with me  And there we go, - and thataposs where the tour ends. Within just a couple of seconds, Ron has completely shown off his apartment which comprises of a bed, a clothing rail, a desk and a kitchen cabinet with a mini-fridge. His building does also have a garden that has been decorated with fairy lights, which is a nice touch, and his bathroom can be found out in the hallway. story: My hair is so thick and heavy it gives me headaches - I have to keep cutting it offA woman has left social media users baffled after confessing that her hair - which at first glance looks completely ordinary - is actually so thick and heavy it gives her headachesThe hair is so heavy it gives her headaches Image: @devlola TikTokByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsAside from when it needs a wash or a trim, hair isnapost always something many of us give much thought to.However, one woman has caused a stir online after sharing how her luscious locks actually give her headaches - especially when she wears it up, as the weight of it is too much for her. Taking to TikTok, a user named Lola Maria de la Caridad, showed off just how thick and heavy her hair really is. Posting under the name @devlola, the social media user revealed sheaposd already shaved half her hair off, giving herself an undercut - but this still wasnapost enough to lighten the load. In a video thataposs been viewed over  million times she films herself using thinning scissors to remove some of her excess hair.Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.She takes the scissors and cuts down pieces of her hair, removing clumps. As @devlola does so, she explains: People keep telling me they have never seen so much hair. I shave half of my head and still get headaches because of how heavy my hair is. I went to the hairdresser two weeks ago and asked them to cut as much hair as they could, but it wasnapost enough. So today I have myself another haircut at home. At the end of the clip, Lola collects all of the hair she has removed into one big lump and holds it over her head - and itaposs a lot! title: dad dying covid says regrets
story: Dad dying of Covid says he regrets not getting vaccine in final texts to familyChristian Cabrera, of Los Angeles, told his brother he regretted not getting the jab in his final texts and asked for him to look after his toddler sonChristian Cabrera left behind three-year-old son Noel Image: GoFundMeByLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsA dad said he regretted not getting vaccinated against Covid- in a series of heartbreaking texts before he died with the virus. Christian Cabrera, , said he would do it in a heartbeat after catching the virus and begged his brother to take care of his three-year-old son Noel.The father, from Los Angeles, US, tested positive for coronavirus at Christmas and was rushed to hospital with pneumonia in both lungs shortly after. Fighting for his le in the emergency room, Mr Cabrera texted his brother I canapost breathe again and said I really regret not getting my vaccine, reports KTLA.He added: “If I can do it all over again, I would do it in a heartbeat to save my le. I’m fighting for my le here and I wish I gotten vaccinated.” In an Instagram post, he told how he was suffering from what has to be the worst pain I ever had in my le.Mr Cabreraaposs family announced that he died on January  in a GoFundMe post to raise money for his son Noel. His brother Jino Cabrera wrote: “We are very sad to announce that our beloved brother Christian Cabrera has lost his battle with Covid pneumonia and passed away tonight. We’re completely heartbroken. He touched so many people’s lives because he was a very loving, kind, generous, caring person with a beautul heart and soul. Mr Cabrera feared he might not survive after catching the virus.  Before his death, Jino told KTLA: He keeps saying aposplease take care of my son.apos He knows he might not make it. He might die in there. After almost two weeks in intensive care, he was put onto a ventilator and he died shortly after. Mr Cabrera was described as a very dedicated father who loved his family so much and had such a big personality that always brightened up anyone’s day. Relatives are raising funds to help pay for his funeral, memorial, burial and ceremony and to ensure his son Noel is looked after. Another post read: Our hearts are completely broken. We did not prepare for his sudden passing so this has really posed a financial hardship on his family.Covid cases have begun to fall in Los Angeles following the Omicron peak but infections remain high.The city reported , new cases and  deaths on Tuesday, according to figures from the County of Los Angeles Public Health.
